text: this was the scene at Iran's
Parliament's this morning witnesses said
four or five gunmen some dressed as
women burst into the building armed with
ak-47 rifles and grenades and rampage
through the corridors security forces
quickly surrounded the Parliament and
lock down the area in central Tehran
inside there were reports of hostages
been taken amid a standoff between the
attackers and police some gunmen fired
out of the windows and Iran's deputy
interior minister said one attacker had
set off an explosive vest the group that
calls itself Islamic state claimed
responsibility for the attack and
released this video reportedly from
inside the Parliament with one gunman
shouting do you think we're going
anywhere we're not we're staying forever
God willing incredibly as the attack
continued some MPs appeared to carry on
with their routine parliamentary
business as other people rushed to
escape the building by whatever means
they could emergency services rushed to
the scene the local media reported a
number of people killed possibly as many
as 12 and many more wounded in the
attack at a nearby hospital
Iran's Health Minister visited some of
those who'd been hurt
this man said he'd been shot from a long
distance by men with big machine guns I
was shot in the leg he said but they
shot others in the head and the chest
about half an hour later several miles
to the south this a second attack on the
shrine of ayatollah khomeini at least
one of the attackers shot several people
before detonating a suicide bomb as
police rushed to the scene there were
reports that at least one person a
gardener had been killed and many others
wounded a state of emergency was
declared across Iran as officials said a
third attack had been thwarted Iranian
backed forces are fighting so-called
Islamic state across Iraq and Syria but
is attacks like this in Iran are very
unusual and there could be few more
symbolic targets than Iran's Parliament
and the mausoleum of its founder James
Londo BBC News
